translated: The Story of King Ruru the Deer
a king of deer named Ruru,
on the lovely bank of the Ganges.
a man fell into the Ganges,
was carried along in the great flood,
crying out in a piteous voice,
going in the middle of the Ganges.
standing on the bank of the Ganges,
his own deed at that time:
I jumped into the great river.’
I entered and pulled him out,
in the darkness of the night.

analyzed: assattha kālam aññāya  tassa aham idam abravi
translated: Knowing the time for my death had come,🔽I said this to him:
Do not tell anyone about me.’
Having gone to the city, he told (the king),
asked about the reason for the wealth;

analyzed: rañño ārocitam mayā  rājā sutvāna vacana
translated: was reported to the king by me;🔽Having heard the message,
the king prepared a sword for him;
‘Right here I will have him killed,
I will do whatever you desire.’
I did not protect my life;
For at that time I was virtuous,
only for the sake of the Awakening.”
The Story of King Ruru, the Sixth.
